name: John Seddon
background: British management thinker, occupational psychologist, and author known for developing the Vanguard Method, applying systems thinking to service organizations. Founder of Vanguard Consulting Ltd. Critiqued command-and-control management and introduced 'failure demand' concept.

principles.name: 1. Systems Thinking
principles.description: Manage organizations as interconnected systems, not silos. Understand purpose from customer's perspective.
principles.falsification: When 1. systems thinking leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: 2. Failure Demand
principles.description: Distinguish value demand (what customer wants) from failure demand (demand caused by failure to do something right first time, e.g., complaints, repeat calls). Typically 30-80% in conventional services.
principles.falsification: When 2. failure demand leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: 3. Vanguard Method
principles.description: Diagnostic (check purpose, demand types, flow); Design (redesign around value demand); Change (intervention to unlearn command-control thinking).
principles.falsification: When 3. vanguard method leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: 4. Anti-Command & Control
principles.description: Reject targets, activity measures, functional silos, batching. Embrace flow, capability measures, customer purpose.
principles.falsification: When 4. anti-command & control leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
